title: DeepSeek researcher pessimistic over AI's impact in startup's first public appearance since success
description: Chinese artificial intelligence (AI) developer DeepSeek made its first public appearance in almost a year after it became a global sensation, fielding a senior researcher who told a government-organised internet conference that he was pessimistic about AI's future impact on humanity.
content: WUZHEN, China, Nov 7 (Reuters) - Chinese artificial intelligence (AI) developer DeepSeek made its first public appearance in almost a year after it became a global sensation, fielding a senior researcher who told a government-organised internet confe... [2584 chars]

title: GLS 2025 | OpenAI’s Oliver J: India is shaping how the world learns with AI
description: At CNBC-TV18’s Global Leadership Summit 2025, OpenAI’s Oliver J said India’s young, curious users — from farmers to students — are shaping the company’s next phase of AI innovation, as the firm sees 2025 as an “inflection point” for artificial intelligence.
content:

title: EU Considers AI Act Pause But Upholds Policy Goals
description: The European Union is considering a partial halt to its landmark artificial intelligence laws in response to pressure from the US government and Big Tech companies.
content:
The European Union is considering a partial halt to its landmark artificial intelligence laws in response to pressure from the US government and Big Tech companies.

title: The Future of Technology: How Innovation Is Shaping the Modern World
description: Technology has become the backbone of modern civilization, driving change in every sector—from healthcare and education to communication, manufacturing, and entertainment. Over the past two decades, we’ve witnessed a transformation unlike any other in human history. title: Who is Soumith Chintala?
description: Indian-origin artificial intelligence maverick and PyTorch co-founder Soumith Chintala is set to leave Meta this month.

title: Taiwan October exports log biggest growth in nearly 16 years on strong AI demand
description: Taiwan's exports grew at their fastest clip in nearly 16 years in October, setting a record as booming demand for chips and artificial intelligence (AI) technology outpaces the effects of U.S. tariffs on the island's goods.
content:
TAIPEI, Nov 7 (Reuters) - Taiwan's exports grew at their fastest clip in nearly 16 years in October, setting a record as booming demand for chips and artificial intelligence (AI) technology outpaces the effects of U.S. tariffs on the island's goods.

description: Artificial intelligence will reshape India’s labour market, the CEA has said
